plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma‚Äôs local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer ‚Äî crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

plugins.name: Font Replacer
plugins.description:
Instantly view all fonts used in your selection, selectively replace specific font families, and preserve font weights and styles when switching to new fonts. Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly swap and manage fonts in your Figma designs

plugins.name: Layer Organizer
plugins.description:
Layer Organizer

Is your Figma file a mess? Layers all over the place? Layer Organizer instantly organizes, groups, and aligns your selected layers ‚Äî with real-time visual feedback.


üöÄ Core Features:

  1. Auto Layer Organization: Instantly arranges and aligns selected layers for a clean, structured layout.
  2. Group Level Selection (1‚Äì5): Groups layers based on / in their names (e.g., Button/Primary), supporting deep hierarchies.
  3. Horizontal & Vertical Spacing: Set precise spacing between groups and layers. Quick presets: 200px, 400px, 1000px.
  4. Combine Single Layers: Merge single-layer groups into one clean ‚ÄúUngrouped‚Äù group. Toggleable.


üëÄ Preview & Visualization:

  1. Real-Time Preview: See changes instantly as you organize.
  2. Group View: Visual list of group names and included layers, with type labels (Frame, Component, Vector, etc.).


‚öôÔ∏è Settings & Shortcuts:

  1. Preference Memory: Automatically remembers your last settings for a smoother workflow.
  2. Default Values: Horizontal/Vertical spacing: 100px, Group level: 1, Combine single-layer groups: On.


‚ö° Performance-First Architecture:

  1. Two-Stage Processing: Measures first, positions after ‚Äî for faster, more accurate results.
  2. Safe Layer Sorting: Uses a temporary frame to reorder layers while preserving hierarchy and structure.


Organize! Preview! Perfect! üßº
plugins.tagline: Auto-arrange and group layers for a cleaner, more organized Figma canvas. üßº

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIs‚Äîwithout ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directions‚Äîinstantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


‚ÑπÔ∏è What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


‚úÖ Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


‚úÖ Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from ‚Äì50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


‚úÖ Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole page‚Äîyour call.


‚úÖ Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


‚ùóÔ∏èWhy it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audience‚Äîright from the start.


‚öôÔ∏è How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"‚Äîdone! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


‚ú® Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


üì® Got feedback? Share it here!

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
‚ú® Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs‚Äîfast.


üöÄ Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides‚Äîthey're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


üîç What it does:

‚Ä¢ Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography‚Äîflags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


‚Ä¢ Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


‚Ä¢ Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


‚Ä¢ Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


‚Ä¢ Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


‚Ä¢ Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


‚Ä¢ Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


‚Ä¢ Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


‚Ä¢ Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


‚Ä¢ Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


‚Ä¢ Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion‚Äîno guessing.


‚Ä¢ Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


üö¶ It detects:

‚úÖ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

‚úÖ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

‚úÖ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

‚úÖ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

‚úÖ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

‚úÖ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

‚úÖ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variable‚Äôs description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documented‚Äîwithout the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


‚Ä¢Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

‚Ä¢Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

‚Ä¢Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

‚Ä¢Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.

plugins.name: Mendly ‚Äî Merge & Fix Broken Variables
plugins.description:
**Streamline your design system maintenance with powerful variable management tools.**


## Key Features


**üîÑ Smart Variable Merging**

- Combine duplicate color variables into one

- Automatically updates all references throughout your design

- Preserves semantic variable relationships

- Optional renaming during merge process


**üîß Broken Variable Detection & Repair**

- Scans current page for broken variable references

- Smart suggestions based on variable naming patterns

- Navigate between elements using the same broken variable

- Batch fix multiple variables at once


**‚ö° Intelligent Analysis**

- Shows direct vs semantic variable usage

- Counts affected elements before merging

- Identifies variable dependencies

- Context-aware replacement suggestions


**üéØ Perfect For**

- Design system cleanup and maintenance

- Removing duplicate variables after design updates

- Fixing broken references after variable deletions

- Streamlining color variable organization


**üí° How It Works**

1. Select source variable (will be removed) and target variable (will remain)

2. Preview affected elements and usage statistics

3. Merge variables with one click - all references automatically update

4. Use the fix tool to repair any broken variable links


Save hours of manual work and keep your design system clean and organized!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly merge duplicate variables and fix broken references in your design system.

plugins.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


üé® Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

üìè Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

‚ö° Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

üìÅ Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

üîÅ Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

üíæ Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.
plugins.tagline: 1.800 Fonts. 1 Click. Done.

plugins.name: Aero Glass Renderer
plugins.description:
This plugin will render an accurate Aero Glass effect based on the formula from Windows 7.


Usage Instructions:

  1. Create a rectangle of any size.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Configure the plugin's values.
  4. Press the "Render" button.


Feel free to use this plugin for any concepts/artwork.

plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:
‚ú® Take control of your typography in Figma ‚Äî instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


üõ†Ô∏è How to Use

  1. Run the plugin ‚Äì FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts ‚Äì View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font ‚Äì Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes ‚Äì Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


‚úÖ Why Use FontSwap?

  1. Detects all fonts in seconds
  2. Bulk replace fonts with one click
  3. Perfect for design clean-up, brand updates, and system consistency
  4. Saves time on every project

plugins.name: Lokki - Comments Export
plugins.description:
Description

A plugin that allows you to turn Figma comments into Jira tasks with a couple of clicks.


Key features

- Export comments to selected Jira project

- Filter comments

- Merge multiple comments into one.

- Turn comment into sub-issue of the existing Jira issue.


How to use

When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 3 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.

  1. During the first run, we'll ask you to connect your plugin with your Jira.
  2. Next you need to generate personal token that allows you access your comments. This is mandatory for plugins operation since Figma do not provide direct access to comments with figma plugin tools.
  3. Select Jira project that you will use as default. You can change it later.
  4. That's it. You can select comments and export them to the Jira.


Sidenote

This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at dev@lokki.tools

Webpage: https://lokki.tools


Data Security & Network access

Our plugin does not save any remote counterpart, it means your data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokes and comments except user identifier related to the premium status and subscription info.


About

- Idea by Kseniia Pashkovska & Oleksandr Drobinin

- Implementation by Oleksandr Drobinin
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma comments into Jira tasks instantly
